page.title: 02ST. MARY'S CHURCH, HAILSHAM
page.content: The present church probably dates from the middle of the{15th century, although there is evidence of it's existence in{1229.}It is built in the perpendicular style. The tower is square and built of sandstone blocks alternating with squares of{knapped flints. Up until{1939}they used to ring the curfew at 8pm in Hailsham using the tenor bell in the church tower. A clock has also been installed to celebrate Queen Victoria's Diamond Jubilee.There are eight bells dating from{1663,}five have been recast. There is only one original window because all the windows were destroyed when a bomb fell nearby in{1943. An extension is now being added to the church which will provide a meeting place with a kitchen and toilets.
